title: Overcrowded Prisons; Cases Pending Per Judge Rising: India's Criminal Justice System in 9 Charts
selftext: How can we trust the system for justice when we are hit by a rich kid's car, when this is the condition of it.
comments:
Source of the data- 
India Justice Report (IJR) 2022- An initiative of Tata Trusts

**Share of women high court judges remains low**

https://preview.redd.it/6mdt1tn6rfbd1.png?width=919&format=png&auto=webp&s=de716ae92835a473f5df207bd269ae84639330d0

**No state/UT fulfilled all quotas for SC/ST/OBC judges at district-court level**

https://preview.redd.it/b5x7wtorrfbd1.png?width=883&format=png&auto=webp&s=dd8ac0389bb6201c3e6780866ef04082e8f49d30

> Police training academies are overloaded For 26.88 lakh police personnel, India has only 211 training schools and academies. 


> While research from across the world suggests that training across fields – including sensitisation, information on legal changes and courses for specialisation – cannot be a one-off event for police personnel. However, with not enough training institutes and the ones that do exist training an average of 12,744 people every year, the scope for this is limited. 


> In most states, a very small part of the total police budget is spent on training.

True. 

The reason I made this post is because we outrage about singular cases when we should outrage over the condition of our systems. Hopefully data might help some Indians better understand the problem.
It's going to go further downhill with the BNS.
Hmm let's see how that goes...

#New Criminal Laws Will Create “a Prosecutorial Nightmare and a Disneyland for Defence Councils”

In an interview to discuss the new criminal laws which came into force yesterday and to explain his deep and fundamental concerns with them, one of the Supreme Court’s highly regarded advocates, Nipun Saxena, says the new criminal laws will create “a prosecutorial nightmare and a Disneyland for defence councils”. Asked if he thinks it would be “a potential mess” he replied “absolutely”. 


http://m.youtube.com/watch?v=-kHfPl5I97Q&pp=ygUXQm5zIHRoZSB3aXJlIGludGVydmlldyA%3D
High time we remove the word JUSTICE and just call it INDIAN CRIMINAL SYSTEM
Not just criminal justice. Same with civil cases. One of the cases being fought by our society for common plot is stuck due to political pressure.
Ya and most citizens think justice is not something that concerns them... Until it does.
